intro: Lastrea crenata, commonly known as the rock fig or rock apple, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Caricaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and small, edible fruits. The plant is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its leaves and stems. It typically grows on rocky outcrops and has a compact, shrub-like growth habit. The fruit, which is yellow when ripe, is often used in local cuisines and traditional medicine.
